intro: Eriogonum harfordii, commonly known as Harford's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and open woodlands. Eriogonum harfordii is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
